meanings.definition: The quality or state of being made of iron.
meanings.sent1: The ironnesses of the gate made it very heavy.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith admired the ironnesses of the sword he had crafted.
meanings.sent3: The ironnesses of the frying pan made it impossible to bend, even with all his strength.
meanings.sent4: Her will was as unyielding as the ironnesses of a fortress.
meanings.sent5: The ironnesses of the anchor kept the ship secure in the storm.

meanings.definition: The characteristic of being strong, unyielding, or unbreakable.
meanings.sent1: The ironnesses of his resolve never wavered.
meanings.sent2: The ironnesses of the mountain stood firm against the winds.
meanings.sent3: Despite his small size, the ironnesses of his determination surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her love was as unbreakable as the ironnesses of a chain.
meanings.sent5: The ironnesses of the old tree trunk made it a perfect bench in the park.

meanings.definition: The act of using irony in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: Her use of ironnesses in the story added a humorous twist.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's ironnesses always left the audience laughing.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's ironnesses in the lesson confused the students at first.
meanings.sent4: His words were filled with subtle ironnesses that only a few understood.
meanings.sent5: The writer's clever ironnesses made the novel a joy to read.
